prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the Euler angles set to 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0 respectively, and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch will be drawn on face_1 of the coordinate system. Step 3: Create the loops and faces Create loop_1 on face_1 with the following curves: 1. line_1: A line with a start point of 0.0, 0.0, and an end point of 0.4611, 0.0. 2. line_2: A line with a start point of 0.4611, 0.0, and an end point of 0.4611, 0.75. 3. line_3: A line with a start point of 0.4611, 0.75, and an end point of 0.0, 0.75. 4. line_4: A line with a start point of 0.0, 0.75, and an end point of 0.0, 0.0. Step 4: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Step 5: Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the coordinate system. Step 6: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction with an extrusion depth of 0.0726, resulting in a final height of 0.0726. This creates a new solid body with the desired dimensions of 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Step 7: Describe the part The shape of this intermediate part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. The length of the part is 0.75, the width is 0.75, and the height is 0.0726.</description>
